TAXI DRIVER (1976) Director: Martin Scorsese Screenplay by Paul Schrader. Music: Bernard Herrmann. Cinematographer: Michael Chapman.
Cast: Robert De Niro, Jodie Foster, Cybill Shepherd, Harvey Keitel, Peter Boyle, Diahnne Abbott.
Robert De Niro plays cab driver and Vietnam vet Travis Bickle – “god’s lonely man” – who narrates his nights on the still-seedy and dangerous streets of New York. Bickle’s growing obsession to “clean up the streets” is both terrifying and funny, and his “you talkin’ to me?” scene is a true – improvised - classic. “An exceptionally beautiful little film, an urban tale about people, and taxi cabs, and grindhouses, and jazz music.

 

There's only one spectacularly restored, 35th Anniversary film print of Taxi Driver in the entire country - and Cinestudio has it!
